name: Chainlink
description: Decentralized oracle network providing tamper-proof data feeds for smart contracts

critical.description: Oracle price feed manipulation or CCIP exploit

high.description: VRF randomness prediction or automation bypass

medium.description: Data feed delays or reporting errors

program_rules: Proof of Concept is required for all submissions. Reports without a working PoC demonstrating the vulnerability will not be considered.
KYC verification is required before bounty payout. Researchers must complete identity verification to receive rewards.
This program follows Primacy of Impact — valid findings are rewarded based on demonstrated impact regardless of whether the specific attack vector was previously known.
Only previously unreported vulnerabilities are eligible. Duplicate submissions will be closed.
Vulnerabilities must be reported through the WhiteClaws platform. Public disclosure before resolution disqualifies the submission.
Testing must not disrupt live protocol operations. Use mainnet forks or testnets for Proof of Concept execution.
For Critical severity findings, the security team may arrange direct communication for expedited resolution.

report_format: Detailed vulnerability description including affected functions
Proof of Concept (code or transaction simulation)
Impact analysis with realistic attack scenario

severity_criteria.critical: Direct loss of funds, protocol insolvency, or permanent freezing of funds exceeding $1M
severity_criteria.high: Temporary freezing of funds, manipulation of protocol parameters, or theft below critical threshold
severity_criteria.medium: Griefing attacks, gas optimization issues with material impact, or accounting discrepancies
severity_criteria.low: Informational findings, best practice violations, or low-impact edge cases

eligibility: Proof of Concept demonstrating exploitability is mandatory
Submissions from current or former employees/contractors of the protocol team are not eligible
Findings must be original work — no re-submission of known issues
